meanings.definition: To increase or decrease in a gradual, steady manner.
meanings.sent1: The excitement in the room ramped up as the concert started.
meanings.sent2: She ramped up her savings by putting aside a little money each week.
meanings.sent3: The competition ramped up when the two friends challenged each other to a race.
meanings.sent4: His anxiety ramped up like a rollercoaster climbing to its peak.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the air ramped up until it was almost palpable.

meanings.definition: A sloping surface used for moving between different levels.
meanings.sent1: The wheelchair ramped allowed easy access to the building.
meanings.sent2: The skateboarders enjoyed practicing tricks on the skate ramp.
meanings.sent3: The playground had a colorful ramped for children to climb and slide down.
meanings.sent4: The delivery workers used the ramped to move heavy boxes into the truck.
meanings.sent5: The construction workers built a sturdy ramped for the workers to carry materials up and down.
